intro: Stylidium pseudohirsutum, commonly known as the hairy triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique trigger mechanism that aids in pollination. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, with prominent stamens that can be triggered by touch. Stylidium pseudohirsutum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands.
